fall off.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if part of something falls off, it becomes separated from the main part
fall off.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The door handle keeps falling off.
A button had fallen off her jacket.
fall off.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if the amount, rate, or quality of something falls off, it decreases
fall off.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Audience figures fell off during the second series of the programme.
fall off.translation[0].definitions[2].d: used to say that someone was very surprised when something happened
fall off.translation[0].definitions[2].e: When I saw my brother on the stage I nearly fell off my chair.
fall off.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a decrease in the level, amount, or number of something
fall off.translation[2].definitions[0].e: The charity reported that gifts have fallen off by more than 60% in value.
